intro: Pycnarrhena borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean spurge, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with characteristic cyathium inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with smooth, waxy leaves that are often lance-shaped. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia, which are common in the Euphorbiaceae family. Pycnarrhena borneensis is adapted to humid, lowland environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
